title: 109_hr5413
content: The Act aims to improve the codification of title 46, United States Code, by incorporating public comments and amendments made after the cutoff date specified in the bill. It specifically addresses personal injury to or death of seamen. The Act aims to improve the codification of title 46, United States Code by addressing personal injury or death of seamen. It amends Section 30104 by allowing seamen or their representatives to bring actions under US laws for injury or death, with the option of admiralty or jury trial. Venue for actions at law will be in the district where the employer resides or has its principal office. Amendments to Chapter 537 are also included. The Act updates Section 53701 of title 46, United States Code by redefining terms like Administrator and Secretary. It also amends Section 53706(c) to prioritize certain vessels in guaranteeing obligations. The Act updates Section 53701 of title 46, United States Code by redefining terms like Administrator and Secretary. It also amends Section 53706(c) to prioritize vessels eligible for guarantees, giving priority to vessels constructed with assistance under the Maritime Security Act of 2003 and vessels suitable for naval auxiliary service in times of war or national emergency. The Secretary of Defense must make a determination within 30 days of receiving a request from the Administrator. Section 53707 of title 46, United States Code is amended to include the Administrator in various subsections. Section 53708 is also amended to remove references to the Secretary and Secretary of Transportation. Section 53707 of title 46, United States Code is amended to include the Administrator in various subsections. References to the Secretary and Secretary of Transportation are removed in section 53708. Section 53712(b) of title 46, United States Code is amended to include requirements for additional payments, collateral, or equity contributions in the loan agreement if the Secretary or Administrator waives a requirement under section 53707(d). The financial condition of the obligor must enable them to meet the waived requirement. Various sections of title 46, United States Code, are amended to replace "Secretary" with "Administrator" in certain instances. Various sections of title 46, United States Code, are amended to replace "Secretary" with "Administrator" in certain instances, except when "Secretary" is followed by "of Transportation" or "of the Treasury". Sections 53711, 53712, 53713 to 53716, 53721 to 53725, and 53734 of title 46, United States Code, are amended to include "or Administrator's" after "Secretary's" in specific subsections. SEC. 4. MISCELLANEOUS AMENDMENTS. Title 46, United States Code, is amended by changing "Naval Reserve" to "Navy Reserve" in chapters 513 and 515. Section 51504(f) is amended to specify that the Secretary will pay State maritime academies for fuel costs of vessels used for training, with maximum amounts set for each fiscal year. Section 51505(b)(2)(B) is also amended. Section 51505(b)(2)(B) is amended to increase the funding to $300,000 for fiscal year 2006, $400,000 for fiscal year 2007, and $500,000 for fiscal year 2008 and beyond. Section 51701(a) is amended to include functions to assist the United States merchant marine as determined necessary by the Secretary. Section 51907 is amended to allow the Secretary of Transportation to provide decorations, medals, and replacements as authorized. "In the table of sections of chapter 519, the item relating to section 51907 is amended to allow the Secretary of Transportation to provide decorations, medals, and replacements as authorized." The new chapter 541 titled "Assistance for small shipyards and maritime communities" is inserted after chapter 539. Section 3506 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2006 is transferred and redesignated as section 54101 of title 46, United States Code. The heading of section 54101 is amended to reflect its new title. Section 55101(b) is amended by inserting "or" after paragraph (2), striking paragraph (3), and redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (3). Section 60301 is amended to increase ton fees for fiscal years 2006 through 2010 and thereafter. The ton fees are increased to 13.5 cents per ton for fiscal years 2006 through 2010, and 6 cents per ton for each fiscal year after, not exceeding 67.5 cents per ton per year initially and 30 cents per ton per year thereafter. SEC. 5. REPEALS. The following provisions are repealed, except for rights, duties, penalties, or proceedings that existed before the enactment of this Act. The Statutes at Large list public laws and sections from 1936 and 2006, including details such as dates, law numbers, and U.S. Code references. The Statutes at Large list public laws and sections from 1936 to 2006, including dates, law numbers, and U.S. Code references such as 1295c, 3502, 3547, 3507(a)-(c)(3), 3555, 3557, 1271-1280, 1280b, 3509, 1295e, 3510, and 2004. On Feb. 8, 109-171, 4001, 27, 121, and 132 are mentioned. The Act will only take effect if H.R. 1442 in the 109th Congress is passed, becoming effective immediately upon its enactment.
